questions.question: What is the term for a reaction to a stimulus?
What term is used to describe a response of an organism to its environment?
Which of the following increases in blood during exercise?
Sweat drips down a student’s neck. What is the student’s body trying to control by sweating?
The body tries to stay 37ºC. Which of these would not help to increase body temperature?
Phototropism : a plant's response to light :: __________ : a plant's response to gravity
Plant A got fresh water. Plant B got salt water.  What did the students most likely observe?

choices.answer: Both A and B showed significant growth
A was healthy, but B wilted
A was wilted, but B was healthy
A changed color, but B stayed the same

questions.question: Whena person ingests bad bacteria, the body responds by vomiting. Why?

choices.answer: The body vomits because the bacteria cause it to vomit
vomiting keeps the person from eating the same foods
vomiting brings up digestive juices that kill the bacteria
The body responds by vomiting to get rid ofthe bad bacteria

questions.question: Which of the following processes helps the body maintain chemical balance?

choices.answer: tears washing away dust in the eyes
hair growing faster in the winter
cells using sugar in the blood

questions.question: 4 beans are planted in cups and placed in a box with a hole in one end.  How will they grow?

choices.answer: All plants will grow toward the hole
All plants will grow straight up
all plants will grow away from the opening
only plants near the opening will grow toward the opening

questions.question: Which of the following scenarios is an example of the evolutionary "fight or flight response"?

choices.answer: A student gets hit in the face and hits back
Parents insist that all chores be done
The principal demands that everyone attend study hall

questions.question: How does perspiration help maintain a safe body temperature on a hot day?

choices.answer: It washes off of his skin.
It causes evaporation and carries away body heat.
It causes evaporation  and saves body heat.
It prevents excess  heat by the sun from entering his body.
Roots to grow toward the light
Plants to grow toward the light
Plants to grow away from the light
regulating a system so internal conditions stay constant
medicine or treatment for an injury or disease
the bodily process of inhaling and exhaling

questions.question: A change or signal in the environment that can make an organism react is called a(n)…
What are the bristles on the ventral side of an earthworm called?
